column4: how does on deactivate the 'smart' (stupid) bash completion? That is, the one that must look at file endings.
bu tnot the usual one, which gentoo and other systems usually use. But the "smart" (or what I would call stupid) that ubuntu uses.
I have no idea what Ubuntu does differently with bash than any other distro.  (It certainly doesn't have anything to do with file extensions...)
Can you tell me what the behavior is that you're seeing that is bothering you and how it's different?

yes it does. When I write "$ evince " press tab I do not get any completion options unless there is a file named .pdf or .dvi or any other filename that it recognize. But I use arxiv,org in my work and their naming of pdfs are not .pdf but just YYMM.XXXX and I cant tabcomplete them!
Huh, you're right. :/  I stand corrected.
and you dont know how to fix this windows-like feature? (win-like as in, it is a bad feature)
Calm down, it takes me a few minutes to google things just like anyone else
oh, I thought you just knew. Most people on IRC either knows or says "you google it". I'll take a look at that file. thnx.
or turn it off entirely by commenting out the lines with "bash_completion" in /etc/bash.bashrc
but doen't that disable bash_completion entirely?
I still want the usual completion, just not the ubuntu-one.

If you disable the bash_completion stuff entirely, it should still tab-complete, but based only on what you've started typing.  e.g. "cd D[tab]" should complete anything that starts with "D" whether it's a directory or not
so my leaning would be to edit /etc/bash_completion to get rid of the PDF settings rather than turning it off entirely, but it's obviously up to you
ok. thanks for clearing things up for me.
